docTitle.titlePart: A Survey of Proxy Caching Mechanisms for Multimedia Data Streams

byline.affiliation:
Department of Computer Science
Washington University in St. Louis

front.div:
Abstract
Although many web caching techniques have been
developed to improve Web performance, existing
proxy caching schemes do not support the
multimedia data stream well. In this paper, we
briefly describe the basic characteristics of steaming
media caching and traditional web caching and
discuss their dissimilarities. Then, we survey the
proxy caching mechanisms for multimedia data
streams, and finally outline potential research topics.
